TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit ProxiesExtensions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Extension methods related to use of proxies with Entity Framework Core.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder UseLazyLoadingProxies (this Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder optionsBuilder, bool useLazyLoadingProxies = true);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder UseLazyLoadingProxies(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder optionsBuilder, bool useLazyLoadingProxies) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function UseLazyLoadingProxies (optionsBuilder As DbContextOptionsBuilder, Optional useLazyLoadingProxies As Boolean = true) As DbContextOptionsBuilder
static member UseLazyLoadingProxies : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder * bool -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder

Docs.param: The options builder, as passed to or exposed AddDbContext.
True to use lazy-loading proxies; false to prevent their use.

summary.para: Turns on the creation of lazy-loading proxies.

Note that this requires appropriate services to be available in the EF internal service provider. Normally this will happen automatically, but if the application is controlling the service provider, then a call to may be needed.

Docs.returns: The same builder to allow method calls to be chained.

summary.para: Turns on the creation of lazy-loading proxies.

Note that this requires appropriate services to be available in the EF internal service provider. Normally this will happen automatically, but if the application is controlling the service provider, then a call to may be needed.
